proof:
Proof. Here, $k > 0$ will be a sufficiently large constant we specify later.
Fix $1 \le s \le \log n$. We union bound over connected trees of size $s$ and events “$T$ is a subtree of $G$ with $e(V(T)) > s - 1 + k$”. Fix any tree $T$ of size $s$. Then note that conditional on $T$ being a subgraph of $G$, we have that $e(V(T)) \sim s - 1 + \text{Bin}(\binom{s}{2} - (s-1), d/n) \le s + \text{Bin}(s^2, d/n)$.
We have $\mathbb{P}(\text{Bin}(s^2, d/n) \ge k) \le s^{2k}(d/n)^k$ by union bound.
Then union bound over $\log n$ possible sizes and then using Markov inequality gives probability $\le \log n/\sqrt{n} = o(1)$.
